commit_list.repo_description: I've forked KDE's Konsole and extended it with a new features including Scroll Marks, Auto Jira Linking and Alt->Win key Emac bindings

commit_list.message:
Various search improvements

- Do not automatically reset the search start line on search hits
    This was causing the annoying behavior that if you were to pause while typing
    in a search term, and it would actually find a hit, then you would be searching
    for the term a second time once you finish typing.

    This commit introduces two new behaviors:
    1. When you show the search bar, all searching will be done from the first
        visible line in the terminal.
    2. This start position is only reset when you
        advance to the next result, by pressing "next", "previous", or the shortcuts
        RETURN or SHIFT-RETURN

- When the view scrolls to a result, it will appear centered.
- When showing the search bar, do not invoke a search, only apply the highlight filters
- Add "search from beginning/end" button
    This will scroll to the top/bottom before searching
    Ctrl+return is also bound to this action
- Text highlighted by mouse will be set as the current search text when the incremental
    search bar is opened
- Add "Search backwards" to search bar options
    Button text is swapped according to reverse search switch

commit_list.message:
Various search improvements

- Do not automatically reset the search start line on search hits
    This was causing the annoying behavior that if you were to pause while typing
    in a search term, and it would actually find a hit, then you would be searching
    for the term a second time once you finish typing.

    This commit introduces two new behaviors:
    1. When you show the search bar, all searching will be done from the first
        visible line in the terminal.
    2. This start position is only reset when you
        advance to the next result, by pressing "next", "previous", or the shortcuts
        RETURN or SHIFT-RETURN

- When the view scrolls to a result, it will appear centered.
- When showing the search bar, do not invoke a search, only apply the highlight filters
- Add "search from beginning/end" button
    This will scroll to the top/bottom before searching
    Ctrl+return is also bound to this action
- Text highlighted by mouse will be set as the current search text when the incremental
    search bar is opened
- Add "Search backwards" to search bar options
    Button text is swapped according to reverse search switch

(cherry picked from commit aa42a27ef33303bf5a279ea195758323724a6fc0)

commit_list.message:
Refactor Database to keep sql operations in single thread

All database operations will now post a job request for the database thread,
then block until it is completed. Testing shows that in practice there is
rarely waiting going on due to multiple jobs in the queue.
The most expensive operation of all: writing to disk, has been delayed until 5
secs after the last database request, and all operations are grouped in an
implicit transactions. This improves thumbnail loading time greatly as the disk
is not written to before thumbnails are ready and on screen, and more
importantly, only written to once (not one time for every thumbnail in the
timeline).

commit_list.message:
Rippled clip trimming keyboard shortcuts

Pressing i/o will set the in/out points of the clip under the playhead in the
timeline.
Shift+i/Shift+o will do a ripple trim (which translates to simply adjusting the
in/out points of the clip in the timeline and nothing more (no blanks
involved). If timelineRippleAllTracks is enabled, it will also adjust clip
length similarly for blanks on other tracks.

In detail:
- TrimClipInCommand and TrimClipOutCommand now uses UndoHelper, and also uses
  the new merge functionality.
- Trim functions in mainwindow/timelinedock/multitrackmodel passes around a
  'bool ripple' parameter, which is what the ShiftModifier toggles in
  mainwindow key handling.
- Blank space adjustment/insertion code is extracted from insertClip into its
  own function, so that it may also be reused in trimClipIn and trimClipOut.

commit_list.message:
Webvfx filter ui: custom ui

Custom UI for your html filter can now be included in the filter UI by
including it next to the html file named "[htmlfilename]_ui.qml"

For convenience, a SimplePropertyUI item is also included for when all you
want to is to set a list of properties for your item. Example:

myfilter.html:

<html><body>blabla</body></html>

myfilter_ui.qml:

import QtQuick 2.1
import Shotcut.Controls 1.0
SimplePropertyUI {
    properties: ["propertyA", "propertyB"]
}

This will have the filter UI present two text fields that set propertyA and
propertyB on the clip.

commit_list.message:
Move all global shortcut handling to MainWindow

In order to have global keyboard shortcuts always work, it is important to keep
strict control on where keyboard events go. This commit moves some timeline
specific keyboard handling from timeline.qml to MainWindow (where it was
already duplicated), and lets the keyevent instead bubble from the qml item all
the way up the parent chain to MainWindow.

The proposed policy is: _all_ global keyboard shorcuts are to be handled in
MainWindow::key{Press,Release}Event. Any widget that accepts keyboard focus is
responsible for event->ignore()ing unhandled keypresses.

Selection setter/getter on TimelineDock
Refactor selection to be a index list

Move all global shortcut handling to MainWindow

In order to have global keyboard shortcuts always work, it is important to keep
strict control on where keyboard events go. This commit moves some timeline
specific keyboard handling from timeline.qml to MainWindow (where it was
already duplicated), and lets the keyevent instead bubble from the qml item all
the way up the parent chain to MainWindow.

The proposed policy is: _all_ global keyboard shorcuts are to be handled in
MainWindow::key{Press,Release}Event. Any widget that accepts keyboard focus is
responsible for event->ignore()ing unhandled keypresses.
Use currentTrack() instead of caling on quickView directly

Bring back break that causes double delete

It went missing in c6c11e82. Hasn't had any impact until now because the selection was lost after
performing a delete.

Keep the playlist table from eating Key_Left/Right

These keys should always control the playhead, but QTableView insists on using
them for moving between cells horizontally, so we need to work around it.

The F1 key prints current focus widget to console

Very useful for debugging keyboard focus issues

ForwardingQuickViewWorkaround, works around createWindowContainer bug

Using createWindowContainer hinders keyevents from propagating, so a
specialized QQuickView class that, if the event was not handled by the qml
scene, will be forwarded to a specific object.
OBSERVE_FOCUS envvar for focus debugging
Expose currentTrack in timelinedock

Hackfix for hang: do not stop consumer, it freezes the app

Not for push, this needs to be addressed
Fix assert when loading empty track
Set LOG_COLORS for colored log output

Allow overriding SUBDIRS

90% of the time, you just want to rebuild mlt/shotcut, so setting SUBDIRS can
now be overriden.  This only makes sense when build-shotcut is set to not clean
up build files, so that includes/libs of all depencies are still available in
Shotcut.app.

ARCHIVE can be disabled to skip taring

For day to day dev you don't need the tarball.

CLEANUP: optionally skip includes/lib etc stripping

In order to repeatedly call build-shotcut.sh for building, either through
qmake+make from shotcut, or by setting envvars to make build-shotcut build
only changed files, build files need to be available. disabling CLEANUP will
make it skip this delete step.
Setting QTDIR will compile with another qt

Halt build when git repository has local changes

If you were to make local changes to test something, you most likely want to
incorporate these and not just throw them away (git reset --hard) upon invoking
build-shotcut. This commit adds a check for this and advices the user to
disable 'GET'.

Set qmake PREFIX from build-shotcut.sh

Makes shotcut's make install install directly into the Shotcut.app dir
Include src/qml in qmake install target

Enable checking for whether the system palette was explicitly set

In order to obey a palette set globally on QApplication, an application
attribute for checking if it's set at all is added.

commit_list.message:
Fix two ripple insert bugs

- When the "other" tracks were right between clips, it would split the clip by
  mistake, instead of just inserting the blank directly.
- When adjusting a blank, the clip would sometimes get offset by one or two
  frames. The reason was insertOrAdjustBlankAt calling resize_clip with the
  'out' argument set to 'length'. It should be 'length - 1'.

Update iconview viewport on index change

Fixes stale view when using Alt+Up/Down shortcuts
Fix compiler warning
Merge adjacent clips feature

Do a better job at sizing playlisticonview grid

Part of pull request #281
New viewmodes: tiled + icons

build-shotcut.sh flags for debug/asan builds

DEBUG_BUILD will enable debug builds for qmake and most configure-based
subprojects.
ASAN_BUILD will make it compile with address sanitizer, but in this case only
for mlt, shotcut and webvfx.

Fix buggy UndoHelper+transitions

When removing a clip, the adjacent clips would also have their trim points
adjusted, which is not desirable when UndoHelper is working to restore the
exact state.
Show "Now loading" message in statusbar
Fix multiple dropped files being inserted in reverse into the playlist

Remove unneeded lupdate_hack and OTHER_FILES from src.pro

Since 5.2.0 and https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-14056 (and the resulting commit:
https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/63208/4//ALL ) the lupdate hack is no
longer needed because lupdate will pick up sources from the INSTALLS directive.

As for OTHER_FILES, qtcreator also seems to be following the same rules, as
testing showd that the files under src/qml do show up in the Ctrl-K finder just
by adding src/qml to INSTALLS.
Expost playlistThumbnails as Q_PROPERTY
EVENT_DEBUG for mouse events
Avoid null-ptr dereference in mainwindow

Fix broken tooltips

Setting visible to true was not enough to show the tooltip

OBSERVE_FOCUS is more verbose

Also includes focusObjectChanged
More focus info on F1

Better focus workaround

Because the focusObjectChanged is not emitted correctly for qquickwidget, this
commit throws away the ForwardingQuickViewWorkaround hack and instead does it
through a single event filter installed on the QWidgetWindow (ie. native handle
for QMainWindow).
EVENT_DEBUG shows key events

Workaround for QTBUG-48343

Because event propagation in qquickwidgets is currently broken, this commit
will use eventfilters to force it through the event handling where it should
normally have passed through: QQuickWindow::sendEvent
Make sure clip keeps focus upon click

Fix deadlocked glwidget

openglContextCreated did not get emitted for some reason, but moving the
offscreenSurface code to initializeGL seems good enough as the context
is ready at that time.

Use ForwardingQuickViewWorkaround again

QQuickWidget has not yet fixed the keyevent propagation issue
Quickwidget from harald
Fixing filterdock

Close filtermenu instead of hiding

This ensures focus is brought back to the filterview.

Fixes #125

Refactor Database to keep sql operations in single thread

All database operations will now post a job request for the database thread,
then block until it is completed. Testing shows that in practice there is
rarely waiting going on due to multiple jobs in the queue.
The most expensive operation of all: writing to disk, has been delayed until 5
secs after the last database request, and all operations are grouped in an
implicit transactions. This improves thumbnail loading time greatly as the disk
is not written to before thumbnails are ready and on screen, and more
importantly, only written to once (not one time for every thumbnail in the
timeline).
Show statusbarmessage while pulsing lock button

TrimClipInCommand and TrimClipOutCommand sets SkipXML flag

Speeds up UndoHelper quite a bit on bigger projects

UndoHelper OptimizationHints

Users of UndoHelper can now supply hints to UndoHelper about things it does not
have to care about. So far there's only SkipXML, which keeps it from
serializing all clips on all timelines (for example when you know the only
change that is going to be done is affecting clip placement/clipinfo changes)
Only print selection logline when it actually changes
Remove likely accidental qDebug print

Rippled clip trimming keyboard shortcuts

Pressing i/o will set the in/out points of the clip under the playhead in the
timeline.
Shift+i/Shift+o will do a ripple trim (which translates to simply adjusting the
in/out points of the clip in the timeline and nothing more (no blanks
involved). If timelineRippleAllTracks is enabled, it will also adjust clip
length similarly for blanks on other tracks.

In detail:
- TrimClipInCommand and TrimClipOutCommand now uses UndoHelper, and also uses
  the new merge functionality.
- Trim functions in mainwindow/timelinedock/multitrackmodel passes around a
  'bool ripple' parameter, which is what the ShiftModifier toggles in
  mainwindow key handling.
- Blank space adjustment/insertion code is extracted from insertClip into its
  own function, so that it may also be reused in trimClipIn and trimClipOut.
UndoHelper uses uuid
QUuid helper functions in mltcontroller
More reliably select first filter
Alt+up/down keys increment/decrement playlist index
QTBUG47714 Workaround
QSGSimpleTextureNode crash workaround in one more place
Prevent Ctrl+Z from doing lift when no undo operations available
Fix PlaylistModel assert when loading new mlt

Share a common QQmlEngine between all qml components

Saves us some memory, but more importantly fixes a crash caused by filter
metadata constructed from one qqmlengine being used from another one at a later
point where the original QQmlEngine was deleted.

Webvfx filter ui: custom ui

Custom UI for your html filter can now be included in the filter UI by
including it next to the html file named "[htmlfilename]_ui.qml"

For convenience, a SimplePropertyUI item is also included for when all you
want to is to set a list of properties for your item. Example:

myfilter.html:

<html><body>blabla</body></html>

myfilter_ui.qml:

import QtQuick 2.1
import Shotcut.Controls 1.0
SimplePropertyUI {
    properties: ["propertyA", "propertyB"]
}

This will have the filter UI present two text fields that set propertyA and
propertyB on the clip.

Select first filter if none selected

If there are filters available, and no filters are currently selected,
automatically select the first one in the list. With this, you only need to
click a clip in the timeline in order to have the filter ui show.
Do not ripple insert into locked tracks
Support multitrack ripple insert
Track locking
UndoHelper, convenience class that handles undo for us

Fix somewhat rare crash when clicking after adding track

install only *.so.5

the qt libraries come with.
Reduces the shotcut tarball size quite a bit.
Simplify key_[digit] keys using a fallthrough

pgup: 1 second

Ctrl-pgup: 5 seconds
Ctrl-shift-pgup: 10 seconds

Instead of just stretching the waveform, which looks weird.

Fix weird behaviors (audio stuttering etc) when splitting clips
remove and lift implicitly selects clip

splitClip will assume other tracks if no clip found on current

This is done using chooseClipAtPosition

selectClipUnderPlayhead(AKA Ctrl+Space) looks at all tracks

Using chooseClipAtPosition, it will select clips on other tracks if there is no
clip on the current one. If there are no non-blank clips at all found on any of
the tracks at the position, the blank clip will be selected.

TimelineDock::chooseClipAtPosition

This function will determine a track and clipindex, given a timeline position.
If trackIndex != -1, it will try looking for nonblank clips at the other tracks
as well.

Show in the filterdock what is currently selected

This is shown in a label directly above the list of filters.

If nothing is selected, "Nothing selected" is shown on top of the filters list.
This makes it less obvious why there is an opaque black box with two disabled
buttons.

Pressing Ctrl+D with a selection active will clear it

commit_list.message: Pgup/pgdown/up/down from searchbar scrolls terminal
commit_list.repo_description: An effort to apply https://github.com/vincepii/konsole-multi-terminal to current konsole master branch

commit_list.message:
Various search improvements

- Do not automatically reset the search start line on search hits
    This was causing the annoying behavior that if you were to pause while typing
    in a search term, and it would actually find a hit, then you would be searching
    for the term a second time once you finish typing.

    This commit introduces two new behaviors:
    1. When you show the search bar, all searching will be done from the first
        visible line in the terminal.
    2. This start position is only reset when you
        advance to the next result, by pressing "next", "previous", or the shortcuts
        RETURN or SHIFT-RETURN

- When the view scrolls to a result, it will appear centered.
- When showing the search bar, do not invoke a search, only apply the highlight filters
- Add "search from beginning/end" button
    This will scroll to the top/bottom before searching
    Ctrl+return is also bound to this action
- Text highlighted by mouse will be set as the current search text when the incremental
    search bar is opened
- Add "Search backwards" to search bar options
    Button text is swapped according to reverse search switch

(cherry picked from commit aa42a27ef33303bf5a279ea195758323724a6fc0)

TimelineDock::chooseClipAtPosition

This function will determine a track and clipindex, given a timeline position.
If trackIndex != -1, it will try looking for nonblank clips at the other tracks
as well.

Show in the filterdock what is currently selected

This is shown in a label directly above the list of filters.

If nothing is selected, "Nothing selected" is shown on top of the filters list.
This makes it less obvious why there is an opaque black box with two disabled
buttons.
Cleanup selection after deleting clips
Restore clipSelected signal from timelinedock
Return/Enter on a timeline selection will open clip
Pressing Ctrl+D with a selection active will clear it

Pressing ctrl-left/right/up/down moves the selection

If there is no selection when pressed, the clip under the playhead is selected
Ctrl+Space selects clip under playhead
TimelineDock::selectClipUnderPlayhead
TimelineDock::clipCount
TimelineDock::clipIndexAtPosition

Selection visual look improvements

- Selected blanks are now gradients from white to transparent
- Selections outside the view are marked by a pulsing shadow on the sides of
  the scrollview. This is to remind the user that operations done on the selection
  will be performed on something outside your view.

Disallow lifting blanks

Undocommands don't play too well with blanks
When pressing X: If nothing selected, remove clip under playhead

Remove and lift uses selection()

Now also supports multiselection
Selection setter/getter on TimelineDock
Refactor selection to be a index list

Move all global shortcut handling to MainWindow

In order to have global keyboard shortcuts always work, it is important to keep
strict control on where keyboard events go. This commit moves some timeline
specific keyboard handling from timeline.qml to MainWindow (where it was
already duplicated), and lets the keyevent instead bubble from the qml item all
the way up the parent chain to MainWindow.

The proposed policy is: _all_ global keyboard shorcuts are to be handled in
MainWindow::key{Press,Release}Event. Any widget that accepts keyboard focus is
responsible for event->ignore()ing unhandled keypresses.
Use currentTrack() instead of caling on quickView directly

Bring back break that causes double delete

It went missing in c6c11e82. Hasn't had any impact until now because the selection was lost after
performing a delete.

Keep the playlist table from eating Key_Left/Right

These keys should always control the playhead, but QTableView insists on using
them for moving between cells horizontally, so we need to work around it.

The F1 key prints current focus widget to console

Very useful for debugging keyboard focus issues

ForwardingQuickViewWorkaround, works around createWindowContainer bug

Using createWindowContainer hinders keyevents from propagating, so a
specialized QQuickView class that, if the event was not handled by the qml
scene, will be forwarded to a specific object.
OBSERVE_FOCUS envvar for focus debugging
Expose currentTrack in timelinedock

Hackfix for hang: do not stop consumer, it freezes the app

Not for push, this needs to be addressed
Fix assert when loading empty track
Set LOG_COLORS for colored log output

Allow overriding SUBDIRS

90% of the time, you just want to rebuild mlt/shotcut, so setting SUBDIRS can
now be overriden.  This only makes sense when build-shotcut is set to not clean
up build files, so that includes/libs of all depencies are still available in
Shotcut.app.

ARCHIVE can be disabled to skip taring

For day to day dev you don't need the tarball.

CLEANUP: optionally skip includes/lib etc stripping

In order to repeatedly call build-shotcut.sh for building, either through
qmake+make from shotcut, or by setting envvars to make build-shotcut build
only changed files, build files need to be available. disabling CLEANUP will
make it skip this delete step.
Setting QTDIR will compile with another qt

Halt build when git repository has local changes

If you were to make local changes to test something, you most likely want to
incorporate these and not just throw them away (git reset --hard) upon invoking
build-shotcut. This commit adds a check for this and advices the user to
disable 'GET'.

Set qmake PREFIX from build-shotcut.sh

Makes shotcut's make install install directly into the Shotcut.app dir
Include src/qml in qmake install target

Update iconview viewport on index change

Fixes stale view when using Alt+Up/Down shortcuts
Fix compiler warning
Merge adjacent clips feature

Do a better job at sizing playlisticonview grid

Part of pull request #281
New viewmodes: tiled + icons

Added a flag to the NewValueEvent to make a distinction between the value being
changed or not. This is needed because the NewValueEvent is used for both
notifications about changed values, as well as simply reading the current value
of a control.

Renaming nodes towards a more xml-like naming scheme

Renamed, in the style of "prevname, newname":

AmpEnvelope, AMPLITUDE_ENVELOPE
Attack, A_val
AttackDt, A_dt
BandWidthEnvelope, BANDWIDTH_ENVELOPE
BaseParam, BASE_PARAMETERS
Category, category
CenterFrequency, center_freq
CoarseDetune, coarse_detune
Decay, D_val
DecayDt, D_dt
Delay, delay
Detune, detune
DetuneType, detune_type
Enabled, enabled
EnvStretch, env_stretch
EnvSustain, env_sustain
ExtFMOscil, ext_fm_oscil
ExtOscil, ext_oscil
FilterBypass, filter_bypass
FilterEnvelope, FILTER_ENVELOPE
FilterParams, FILTER_PARAMETERS
FixedFreq, fixed_freq
FixedFreqET, fixed_freq_et
ForcedRelease, forced_release
FreeMode, free_mode
FreqEnvelope, FREQUENCY_ENVELOPE
FreqEnvelopeEnabled, freq_envelope_enabled
FreqLfoEnabled, freq_lfo_enabled
Frequency, freq
KeyShift, key_shift
Master, MASTER
MaxKey, max_key
MinKey, min_key
OctaveDetune, octave_detune
OscilBaseFunc, base_function
OscilPhase, oscil_phase
Panning, panning
Release, R_val
ReleaseDt, R_dt
FreqEnvelope, FREQUENCY_ENVELOPE
Type, type
VelocityOffset, velocity_offset
VelocitySense, velocity_sensing
Volume, volume

commit_list.message:
Controlify addnote voice. Turned the stack addnoteparam structs into pointers.

This implies changes also in ADnote.cpp and ADNoteParameters, invoked like this:
perl -i -pe 's/(VoicePar\[.*?\])\./$1->/g' ../Params/ADnoteParameters.cpp ADnote.cpp
perl -i -pe 's/(NoteVoicePar\[.*?\])->/$1./g' ADnote.cpp

The fltk GUI will also have to have a transformation like this applied to work with the new adnotevoice
